​The table gives values of the functions <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> for selected values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>. The pattern of the values of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> continue, repeating every interval of width <math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math>, for <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 48"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>48</mn></math>. The graph of the function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is the result of a sequence of dilations of the graph of the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>. Which of the following could describe those dilations?

choices.label: ​A horizontal dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 third"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> and a vertical dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 half"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

​A horizontal dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 half"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> and a vertical dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 third"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>

​A horizontal dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 half"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> and a vertical dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 half"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
​A horizontal dilation by a factor of  <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> and a vertical dilation by a factor of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>

content.answer: ​A horizontal dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 half"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> and a vertical dilation by a factor of <math alttext="1 half"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
